elevated levels of this antigen are associated with prostatic enlargement and
prostate cancer: prostate-specific antigen

what body system is composed of glands and sends chemical messengers called
hormones into the blood to act on other glads and organs: endocrine system

what body system plays a central role in immunity: lymphatic system

what condition results when the tissue from the inner lining of the uterus
occurs abnormally in other pelvic or abdominal locations? endometriosis

what condition, caused by the presence of an extra chromosome being present in
all cells of the body, is characterized by mental retardation, flat face with
short nose, slated eyes, broad hands and feet, stubby fingers, and a protruding
lower lip? down's syndrome

what condition, caused by the compression of the nerve leading to the hand, is
characterized by symptoms including pain, tingling, burning, and numbness of the
hand? carpal tunnel syndrome

what disease has the symptom of polyuria and polydipsia? central diabetes
insipidus

what disease is characterized by exopthalmos, tachycardia, restlessness,
insomnia, weight loss, and enlarged thyroid gland? Graves' disease

what disease is characterized by the destruction of the myelin sheath on nerve
cells in the central nervous system with replacement by plaques of sclerotic
tissue? multiple sclerosis

what do high levels of Bence Jones protein in the urine and serum indicate?
multiple myeloma

what does the hemoccult test screen for? colorectal cancer

what glands are found on the back side of the thyroid gland? parathyroid gland

what hormone is measured in either the blood or urine to indicate pregnancy?
human chorionic gonadotropin

what hormone is produced by the parathyroid glands? parathyroid hormone

what hormone is produced by the testes? testosterone

what hormone is produced by the thyroid gland? thyroid hormone

what imaging technique creates images of the body using magnetic waves? magnetic
resonance imaging

what is the flap of cartilage that closes over the trachea during swallowing so
that food travels down the esophagus called? epiglottis

what is the major hormone produced by the pancreas? insulin

what is the medical term for a blood clot? thrombus

what is the medical term for a heart attack? myocardial infarction

what is the medical term for a mass or swelling containing blood? hematoma

what is the medical term for a stroke? cerebrovascular accident

what is the medical term for high blood pressure? hypertension

what is the medical term for nerve pain? neuralgia

what is the medical term for the disease of heart muscle? cardiomyopathy

what is the name of the battery-powered device that delivers stimulation to
nerves to relieve acute and chronic pain? TENS

What is the name of the condition in which an extreme decrease in the amount of
oxygen in the body with increase of carbon dioxide leads to loss of
consciousness or death? asphyxiation

what is the name of the condition in which an individual is unable to speak?
aphasia

what is the name of the condition in which bone marrow fails to produce red
blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets? aplastic anemia

what is the name of the condition in which erythrocytes assume an abnormal
crescent or sickle shape, causing the cells to clump together and create clots
that block blood vessels? sickle cell anemia

what is the name of the condition in which low or absent iron levels lead to low
hemoglobin concentration or deficiency of red blood cells? iron deficiency
anemia

what is the name of the condition in which one side of the body is paralyzed?
hemiplegia

what is the name of the condition in which red blood cells are destroyed and
bone marrow cannot compensate for their loss? hemolytic anemia

what is the name of the condition in which the mucous membrane of the stomach
fails to produce a factor (intrinsic factor) that is necessary for the
absorption of vitamin b-12 and the proper function of red blood cells?
pernicious anemia

what is the name of the condition in which the spasm and narrowing of bronchi
leads to bronchial airway obstruction? asthma

what is the name of the condition in which there is a lower than normal number
of red blood cells or a decrease in hemoglobin in cells? anemia

what is the name of the condition that involves a non-cancerous enlargement of
the prostate gland? benign prostatic hyperplasia

what is the name of the condition that some women experience after given birth,
with symptoms including moodiness and sad feelings? postpartum depression

what is the name of the device worn by patients 24 hours per day that detects
abnormal heart rhythms? holter monitor

what is the name of the entire chest cavity, containing the lungs, heart,
trachea, esophagus, and bronchial tubes? thoracic cavity

what is the name of the glands that sit on top of the kidneys? adrenal glands

what is the name of the large space between the lungs? mediastinum

what is the name of the membrane that surrounds each lung? pleura

what is the name of the procedure in which a machine is used to filter wastes

what is the name of the procedure in which amniotic fluid is removed for

what is the name of the procedure in which fluid is injected into the abdominal

what is the name of the procedure in which one or both ovaries are removed?
oophorectomy

transurethral resection of the prostate

what is the name of the procedure in which the fallopian tube or tubes are

what is the name of the procedure in which the gallbladder is removed?
cholecystectomy

what is the name of the procedure that measures the blood flow in vessels via

what is the name of the procedure that opens the windpipe to the outside of the

what is the name of the procedure that records brain wave activity?

what is the name of the protein in erythrocytes that helps carry oxygen in the

what is the name of the region that lies above the stomach? epigastric

what is the name of the small cells that help blood to clot? platelets

what is the part of the brain that controls body movements, thought, reasoning,
